reviewText: A vintage film -- comparable to films produced and filmed in this time period. Could it be better -- yes, it was just OK!

I love Paul Blackthorne and so picked this up expecting it to be great--it wasn't. The DVD didn't have subtitles that I could find and the sound was of such that the actors' voices were scarcely audible. Not only that, the actual plot jumped around like it couldn't decide what it wanted to be. It started to even out by the last twenty minutes or so, but it wasn't enough to save it.
